definitions.definition: To try to avoid giving a direct answer.
examples: When I asked them if they had been at the party, they fudged .

definitions.definition: To alter something from its true state, as to hide a flaw or uncertainty , deliberately but not necessarily dishonestly or immorally .
examples: The results of the experiment looked impressive, but it turned out the numbers had been fudged .
I had to fudge the lighting to get the color to look good.

definitions.definition: To cheat , especially in the game of marbles .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To try to avoid giving a direct answer.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To alter something from its true state, as to hide a flaw or uncertainty , deliberately but not necessarily dishonestly or immorally .
( dated , ambitransitive ) To botch or bungle something.
To cheat , especially in the game of marbles .
